input.description: The timeout value is seconds. This is the time after which the command will timeout regardless of whether the command execution is complete or not.
The class option specifies whether to display a list of NAS or client objects. Valid values – client, nas
The dateformat option specifies the format you want to use to display dates. Valid values - MM/DD/YYYY, DD-MM-YYYY, DD.MM.YYYY, YYYY.MM.DD, YYYY-MM-DD
Use the detail option to display management class, file space, backup, and archive information depending on the command with which it is used. Valid values-true,false

The fromnode option permits one node to perform commands for another node. A user on another node must use the set access command to permit you to query, restore, or retrieve files or images for the other node.
The timeformat option specifies the format in which you want to display system time. Valid values – 1) HH:MM:SS 2) HH,MM,SS 3)HH.MM.SS 4) hh:mm:ssAM/PM. The formats 1,2 and 3 follow 0-23 hour format.

The nasnodename option specifies the node name for the NAS file server when processing NAS file systems. The node name identifies the NAS file server to the Tivoli Storage Manager server. The server must register the NAS file server. Note: This tag is required when ‘NAS’ is provided as value for ‘class’ tag.
Specifies an optional character string which can include wildcards. Use this argument to specify a subset of file spaces. The default is to display all file spaces.

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" omit-xml-declaration="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <items> <item> <operation-name> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">query-filespace</xsl:text> </operation-name> <xsl:if test="string('${timeout secs}')!=''"> <timeout-secs> <xsl:value-of select="'${timeout secs}'" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </timeout-secs> </xsl:if> <command-options> <xsl:if test="string('${class}')!=''"> <class> <xsl:value-of select="'${class}'" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </class> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string('${dateformat}')!=''"> <dateformat> <xsl:value-of select="'${dateformat}'" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </dateformat> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string('${detail}')='true'"> <detail /> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string('${fromnode}')!=''"> <fromnode> <xsl:value-of select="'${fromnode}'" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </fromnode> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string('${timeformat}')!=''"> <timeformat> <xsl:value-of select="'${timeformat}'" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </timeformat> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string('${nasnodename}')!=''"> <nasnodename> <xsl:value-of select="'${nasnodename}'" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </nasnodename> </xsl:if> </command-options> <command-arguments> <xsl:if test="string('${filespace}')!=''"> <filespace> <xsl:value-of select="'${filespace}'" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </filespace> </xsl:if> </command-arguments> </item> </items> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: Utility to create items xml for Query Filespace process.
